problems.title: Recursive array sum
problems.description: Trace the recursive sum of array elements.
hints: Adds elements from index n-1 down to 0
Notice initial call is with n=3
problems.explanation:
sum(arr, 3) -> sum(arr, 2) + arr[2] (6)
sum(arr, 2) -> sum(arr, 1) + arr[1] (4)
sum(arr, 1) -> sum(arr, 0) + arr[0] (2)
sum(arr, 0) -> 0
Total: 0+2+4+6 = 12.

problems.title: Nested Loops with Break/Continue
problems.description: Complex flow control in nested loops.
hints: Check conditions carefully for each pair
problems.explanation:
i=1,j=1: cont. i=1,j=2: print 12. i=1,j=3: i+j=4 not >4, print 13.
i=2,j=1: print 21. i=2,j=2: cont. i=2,j=3: 2+3=5>4 break.
i=3,j=1: print 31. i=3,j=2: 5>4 break.

problems.title: Pointer Arithmetic on 2D Array
hints: a is pointer to first row
*(a+1) decays to pointer to first element of second row
problems.explanation: *(a+1) is row 1 {30,40}. +1 points to 40. * gets value 40.

problems.title: Bitwise Operations Mix
problems.description: Combined bitwise AND, OR, XOR and shift.

problems.title: Function Static Recursion
hints: Static x is shared across all recursive calls
Increments happen before the recursive return sums up
problems.explanation:
Call fun(5). x=1. ret f(4)+1
 fun(4). x=2. ret f(3)+2
 fun(3). x=3. ret f(2)+3
 fun(2). x=4. ret f(1)+4
 fun(1). x=5. ret f(0)+5
 fun(0). ret 0.
Total sum: 0+5+4+3+2+1 = 15.

problems.title: String Pointer Manipulation
problems.explanation: p points to 'H'. p++ points to 'E'. *p='a' changes 'E' to 'a'. Output HaLLO.

problems.title: Complex Post/Pre Increment
hints: Order of evaluation is unspecified in standard but assume left-to-right for dry run typical logic
However, strict standard calls it undefined behavior. But for dry runs, apply precedence
problems.explanation: Assumption: L to R. a++ uses 5, a=6. ++a uses 7, a=7. --a uses 6, a=6. Sum: 5+7+6=18. Output 6 18.

problems.title: Array Reversal Pointer
Recursion Output Order
problems.explanation:
3 -> print 3 -> call 2
2 -> print 2 -> call 1
1 -> print 1 -> call 0
0 returns
1 -> print 1
2 -> print 2
3 -> print 3

problems.title: Matrix Diagonal Sum
problems.description: Logic for primary and secondary diagonal.
hints: Check if center (1,1) is added twice

problems.title: Reference to Pointer
hints: p = &x changes which address ptr holds in main
static logic allows x to survive
problems.explanation:
Initial ptr points to z (10). Print 10.
change(ptr): ptr refers to main's ptr. sets it to address of static x (100).
Back in main, ptr now points to x. Print 100.

problems.title: Switch in Loop
hints: Case 1 prints B, falls through to C
problems.explanation:
i=0 -> A. i=1 -> B then C. i=2 -> C. i=3 -> D. Total: ABC CD? Wait.
i=1 prints B then falls through to C. Correct.
i=2 prints C. Correct.
Output: A B C C D. Wait. B falls to C. 
i=0: A
i=1: B C (break)
i=2: C (break)
i=3: D
Total: ABCCD. Let me update expected output.

problems.title: Do While Nested
problems.explanation:
i=1. j=1. Print 1. j=2. stop. print space. i=2.
i=2. j=1. Print 1. j=2. Print 2. j=3 stop. print space. i=3.
i=3. j=1,2,3. Print 123. j=4 stop. print space. i=4 stop.
Note: space after each group.

problems.title: Array Pointer Indexing
Recursive Digit Sum
Ternary with Increment
problems.explanation: a++ uses 5. 5>5 False. Execute b++. b becomes 7 (was 6). Return 6. a became 6. Result 6.

hints: Pointer - Pointer = number of elements between

hints: && has higher precedence than || usually, but grouping matters

problems.description: Interaction of default args and static.

problems.title: Complex Type Casting
Recursive Array Print
problems.explanation: Print 1, recursive call with {2,3}. Print 2, rec call {3}. Print 3. Done.

problems.title: Bitwise Shift Loop
Void Pointer
hints: Void pointers cannot be dereferenced directly
Must cast to typed pointer first
problems.explanation: Casts p to int* then derefs -> 10.

problems.title: String Const Modification
problems.description: Attempting to modify string literal causes segfault usually, but here checking code logic if array.

problems.title: Nested Ternary
Reference Parameter Swap
While Loop Post-Decrement
hints: x-- returns current value for condition
problems.explanation:
3>0 True, x becomes 2. Print 2.
2>0 True, x becomes 1. Print 1.
1>0 True, x becomes 0. Print 0.
0>0 False, x becomes -1. End.

problems.title: Pass Array Size
hints: sizeof(pointer) is typically 4 or 8 (assume 8 for 64-bit or 4 for 32-bit output usually expects 4/8)

problems.title: Comma Operator
Function Call Order
hints: Order of argument evaluation is unspecified
Usually right to left or left to right
Assume Standard output could be AB or BA
problems.explanation: Commonly BA (Right to left) in many compilers, but AB is also valid. We'll specify BA for this context.

problems.title: Global Static
Nested While Break
Modifying String Literal Check
hints: cout prints string from address until null

problems.title: Structure Basic Trace
Float Equality
hints: float 0.7 is slightly less/more than double
problems.explanation: Float precision vs double default. Usually Less or Equal depending on representation. 0.7f vs 0.7. 0.7 cannot be exactly represented in binary. Double has more precision. Float 0.7 is approx 0.69999... Double 0.7 is 0.7. So float < double. Output Less.
